title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
text: function allows user generate formatted code (email, document, copy, message, etc.) fly. accepts mainly word, pdf html formats, format accepted rmarkdown computer. use function, simply copy piece code run render_code() arguments interest us. want content R code, use code argument FALSE. pdf format, can change font size using font_size argument. Also, can change browser opens file default browser argument. argument ..., can specify knitr arguments included chunk. example, can add eval = TRUE (want R code evaluated (result displayed)), echo = FALSE (want display code)... information function opts_chunk directly https://yihui.org/knitr/options/#chunk-options see available options descriptions. open argument set FALSE browser argument ignored.

title: Generate a file with formatted code — render_code
code: # Copy a snippet of code if (clipr::clipr_available()) {     clipr::write_clip("plot(AirPassengers)", allow_non_interactive = TRUE) }  render_code(     output_format = "word",     echo = TRUE ) #> CLIPR_ALLOW has not been set, so clipr will not run interactively  render_code(     output_format = "html",     eval = FALSE ) #> CLIPR_ALLOW has not been set, so clipr will not run interactively  # \donttest{ render_code(     output = "pdf",     eval = TRUE,     font_size = 16 ) #> CLIPR_ALLOW has not been set, so clipr will not run interactively # }
